TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
11 hours ago, Beale said:

I seem to keep forgetting that.

https://github.com/Tantares/Tantares

https://github.com/Tantares/TantaresLV
 

I didn't update my tantares for a while so I download them but somehow nearly all the tantares LV parts are missing except some old parts that are grey out. All the main Tantares Part are fine but LV one didn't work (KSP1.81).

*Fixed I forgot to delete ole Tentares First but have another problem some texture in revamp n-1 top and bottom side of most parts to be exact are missing, is this cause by it is unfinished or bug? al so some symystry are wrong

Edited July 28, 2020 by derega16

@derega16 Those parts with missing textures are very much WIP. That's going to be the new N-1 once the parts are all finished.

@Beale Have you considered looking into making historical fairings with Simple Adjustable Fairings? @CobaltWolfs team have made some awesome purpose-built and historical fairings to sit along side the stock-style fairings. For example, a properly shaped Soyuz or proton fairing that we could just slap on for "real world" launches, such as Soyuz, Progress, Salyut or Mir. They could be an optional download so you still keep the base mod dependency free with the included stock-style fairings.

Edited July 29, 2020 by DJ Reonic
Tags

Blok-G over  <moon redacted>


18 hours ago, DJ Reonic said:

 

@Beale Have you considered looking into making historical fairings with Simple Adjustable Fairings? Cobalt's team have made some awesome purpose-built and historical fairings to sit along side the stock-style fairings. For example, a properly shaped Soyuz or proton fairing that we could just slap on for "real world" launches, such as Soyuz, Progress, Salyut or Mir. They could be an optional download so you still keep the base mod dependency free with the included stock-style fairings.

SAF is something I would really love to do, it's just fitting the time in which is difficult. I would be deeply please to collaborate with somebody on them as in BDB.

@Beale When you finish the N1 remake, I have something to launch it on: the N1 Launch Plate that will be in v2.1 of Modular Launch Pads:

The actual N1 tower will come much later.  

Since the N1 was just set upon a hole in the launch pad, I made a giant version of my round launch plates to approximate how it was done.
Apollo - LK Test Project

33 minutes ago, _Krieger_ said:

Looking awesome @Beale, my only suggestion would be to add some plumbing between the tank and the engines, it looks a bit odd with them sitting on the plate unconnected to the fuel tank.

It's definitely high up on the list Just wrapping up a few other necessary pieces first.

 

 

Speaking of...

Fairings,  we suddenly need a new 3.75m fairing base, and a 2.5m fairing base to replace the icky old N1 model we have.

Going for a wheels withing wheels ever turning, ever watching, be not afraid  design - hopefully this means whatever payload you use, there will always be a nice clean ring stucture to mount to, 0.625m1.25m, etc...

I approve of this design x9001. I really like the idea of adding an extra ring as you go up in size. I think this should be your default fairing base style going forward.

8 hours ago, Beale said:

Это определенно высоко в списке Просто завершая несколько других необходимых частей сначала.

 

 

Говоря о...

Обтекатели, нам внезапно понадобится новая база обтекателя 3,75 м и база обтекателя 2,5 м, чтобы заменить устаревшую модель N1, которая у нас есть.

Выбирая колеса, у которых колеса вращаются, когда-либо смотрят, не бойтесь   дизайна - надеюсь, это означает, что независимо от того, какую полезную нагрузку вы используете, всегда будет хорошая чистая кольцевая конструкция для монтажа, 0,625м1,25 м и т. Д.

 

if you are sending a fairing, then pay attention to the technical items on it. All possible rectangles and squares. With them, the fairing will look better and the model itself will be more interesting.

and of course I would still recommend making first stage stabilizers.
